page.title: 08Recreation.The Village Hall.
page.content: The village hall was built in 1922. It is quite large and has a stage at one end.The floor is wooden and very smooth.The hall is in continual use. It is used in the mornings by a Play Group for pre-school children.The junior school also uses the hall for country dancing and drama lessons. Other users include the Youth Club who make use of the snooker table which is permanently situated at one end of the hall.Table tennis and badminton are also played by Youth Club members. Other local groups to use the hall are the Brownies,the Girls Brigade,the Boys Brigade and the Womens Institute. Various clubs hold their committee meetings in the hall.Many of the villagers also enjoy a weekly game of bingo.Dances and discos are held, usually to raise money for local events.
